caseTitle: Arshad Ali Tabassum v. The Registrar, Lahore High Court, Lahore
tagline: The provisions of sections 148, 149, 324, 337-L(2) & 452, P.P.C. & 7(h) of the Anti-Terrorism Act, 1997 are not attracted in the case of injuries suffered by the lawyers of Sahiwal who had gathered to take out a rally in support of the independence of judiciary. The conviction of the accused police officials under these sections is set aside and instead they are each convicted under section 337-H(1), P.P.C. and sentenced to simple imprisonment for two years along with payment of daman of an amount of fifty thousand rupees to be disbursed amongst injured victims in equal shares.
